page.title: 02LANDSCAPE IN ASTON-J-M
page.content: The landscape of the region is fairly homogenous,consisting of rolling{grass {land}divided into small fields by {hedges}which have not changed much in the last 100 years.They are cut by a flailing machine,few are laid nowdays. There are many free standing{trees},in hedges,groups and singly in the fields About 6 small{deciduous woods}remain. The map shows most fields to have a {pond},but many have been filled; those that remain are surrounded by rushes. Marl from these pits was spread on the fields,or used for bricks.The{river and its tributaries cut deep into the land and there is evidence of {glaciation}in the valleys.The{canal crosses the river Weaver on an{aqua- {duct}in a picturesque wooded valley.
